references.paper_title: Image classification with deep learning in the presence of noisy labels: A survey
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of existing methods for image classification with noisy labels, providing a valuable foundation for the current work.

references.paper_title: A closer look at memorization in deep networks
references.reason: This work investigates memorization in deep learning models and its effects on the model's ability to handle noisy labels, which is directly relevant to the challenges addressed in the current research.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised learning of visual features by contrasting cluster assignments
references.reason: This paper proposes a novel contrastive learning approach for unsupervised visual feature learning, which offers insights into learning effective representations in the presence of noise.

references.paper_title: Encoder-decoder with atrous separable convolution for semantic image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces an encoder-decoder architecture for semantic segmentation, which is a foundational model that is used in the current research and serves as the starting point for comparisons.
This very recent work presents a foundational model for universal image segmentation, providing a strong baseline and enabling new possibilities for research on smoke segmentation with noisy labels.
